title: Pizzaiola Sauce
introduction: Pizzaiola Sauce, derived from the Neapolitan tradition, embodies the essence of Italian culinary artistry. Typically, this sauce is used to flavor small steaks or chops, but it also pairs wonderfully with spaghetti. Contrary to its name, it is not commonly used on pizza due to the extreme heat of wood-fired ovens, which would overcook the already prepared sauce. The combination of tomatoes, garlic, and oregano makes this sauce distinctively flavorful.
ingredients: 2 large garlic cloves, very finely chopped
1 (28-ounce) can imported Italian peeled tomatoes with their juice, chopped
instructions: 1. In a large skillet, cook the garlic in the oil over medium heat until golden, about 2 minutes. Stir in the crushed red pepper.

2. Add the tomatoes, oregano, and salt to taste. Bring the sauce to a simmer. Cook, stirring occasionally, 20 minutes or until the sauce is thickened. Serve hot. Can be made ahead and stored in a tightly sealed container in the refrigerator up to 5 days or in the freezer up to 2 months.
